programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Adding the Doha title to her successful Australian Open defence, Victoria Azarenka kept Serena Williams at bay as the top two seeds served up a memorable final in 2013.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: A 36-year-old Novak Djokovic rolled back the years in a three-set classic against world number one Carlos Alcaraz to claim the Cincinnati title - his 39th ATP Masters 1000 crown.

programme.title: Connors v Borg 1976
programme.desc: Home favourite Jimmy Connors fought the number two seed Bjorn Borg in the finale to the men's singles at the 1976 US Open. Borg dispatched champion Manuel Orantes en route to the final.

programme.title: Laver v Roche 1969
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 1969 US Open, history was made, as Rod Laver became the only man in the Open Era to win the Calendar Grand Slam - owning all four majors in the same year.

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rio
programme.desc: In the final of the Rio Open, defending champion Sebastian Baez takes on Alexander Muller. The Frenchman enters his second ATP final of the year after victory in Hong Kong. (23.02)

programme.title: US Open 2013: Nadal v Djokovic
programme.desc: Revisit the 2013 US Open final as Rafael Nadal overpowered Novak Djokovic to win a second Flushing Meadows title.

programme.title: US Open 2019: Nadal v Medvedev
programme.desc: Rafael Nadal won his 19th Grand Slam and fourth US Open title with victory over Daniil Medvedev in 2019 at Flushing Meadows.

programme.title: WTA Final: Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: 2021 Olympic gold medallist Belinda Bencic looks to capture her first title since returning from maternity leave, as the Swiss star faces Ashlyn Krueger in the Abu Dhabi final. (08.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Transylvania
programme.desc: A third career singles title is the target for Anastasia Potapova, as the world number 32 takes on unseeded Italian Lucia Bronzetti in the final of the Transylvania Open in Cluj. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Buenos Aires
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca's soaring career hits new heights, as the 18-year-old becomes the youngest ATP clay finalist since Carlos Alcaraz when he faces Francisco Cerundolo in Buenos Aires. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Dallas
programme.desc: Denis Shapovalov targets his biggest career title yet, as the 25-year-old Canadian competes in the final of the Dallas Open against Norway's world number five Casper Ruud. (09.02)

programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: Chinese F1 GP Highlights

programme.desc: It's lights out at Suzuka for the Japanese Grand Prix. World champion Max Verstappen starts from the front of the grid with the McLaren duo of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri behind. (06.04)

programme.title: Bahrain F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: It's lights out for the 2025 Bahrain Grand Prix. Oscar Piastri holds pole position with his McLaren teammate Lando Norris down in P6. Charles Leclerc joins Piastri on the front row. (13.04)

programme.title: Saudi Arabian F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: It's lights out in Jeddah for the 2025 Saudi Arabian Grand Prix. Reigning world champion Max Verstappen crossed the finish line in P1 last season at the Jeddah Corniche Circuit. (20.04)

programme.title: Miami F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: Polesitter Max Verstappen is joined by Lando Norris and Kimi Antonelli heading into turn one, while Lewis Hamilton tries to fight through the field from P12. (04.05)

programme.title: Emilia Romagna F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: It's lights out at Imola for the 2025 Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. Last season, reigning world champion Max Verstappen held off a late Lando Norris charge to claim race victory. (18.05)

programme.title: Monaco F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: On the streets of Monte Carlo, the 2025 Monaco Grand Prix arrives. Lando Norris lines up in P1 with Charles Leclerc behind him as the Monegasque pursues back-to-back home wins. (25.05)

programme.title: Legends Of The Pharaohs

programme.title: Legends Of The Pharaohs

programme.title: Queens Of Ancient Egypt

programme.desc: Trobiano's: Gordon Ramsay meets struggling executive chef Anthony Trobiano, who's sinking under half a million dollars of debt at his restaurant in Great Neck, New York.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Whacking Day: Lisa asks singer Barry White to help stop the cruel Springfield 'Whacking Day' tradition of hitting snakes with sticks.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Krusty Gets Cancelled: When Krusty's show gets axed, Bart and Lisa enlist Bette Midler, Hugh Hefner, the Red Hot Chili Peppers and Elizabeth Taylor to help him get it back.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's Barbershop Quartet: Homer reminisces about the Be Sharps, the barbershop quartet he was in with Barney, Apu and Principal Skinner. Guest starring George Harrison.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Goes to College: Homer has to go to university to study nuclear physics when it becomes clear that he's unqualified for his job as nuclear power plant safety inspector.

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: (1990) Classic family comedy starring Macaulay Culkin. A boy's parents forget to take him on holiday with them. Then two inept burglars turn up. Can our resourceful young hero outwit them?

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Bottle Episode: Homer must transport a million-dollar bottle of wine to Mr Burns's mansion. And for once, it's not actually him who screws it up.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - The Flandshees of Innersimpson: Flanders vows never to speak to Homer again after Homer steals his new headphones. Homer's absolutely delighted - at first...

programme.title: Knives Out
programme.desc: (2019) Sharp, eccentric murder-mystery starring Daniel Craig as a detective anonymously hired to investigate the death of a wealthy writer (Christopher Plummer). With Ana de Armas.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: Oprah with Meghan and Harry - and, on the News, the royal response. Plus: Piers Morgan on Good Morning Britain; The Celebrity Circle; and Teen First Dates.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's sharpest armchair critics think of Line of Duty, This Is My House, The Proof Is Out There, Formula 1: Drive to Survive, Countdown and This Morning?

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will Is Home Alone: When Will's mum goes on a weekend away with an 'old friend', the boys take advantage of having the house to themselves. It's all fun until the morning.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The Camping Trip: Will draws on his scouting experience to cope with the last trip he's organised for the boys before they go their separate ways. But the others are unprepared.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Edinburgh musician Jamie is tired of groupies and flings, and is looking for a deeper connection. Jasmin from Bognor Regis has ME and needs acceptance from a new lover.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: Oprah with Meghan and Harry - and, on the News, the royal response. Plus: Piers Morgan on Good Morning Britain; The Celebrity Circle; and Teen First Dates.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Dodger can no longer hide his trauma from those closest to him. Mercedes makes an unexpected connection. A scare leaves Cleo and Sienna in turmoil. And Tinhead resorts to drastic measures.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: New mum Cleo continues to struggle, while tensions rise with Sienna. Mercedes makes an unexpected connection. And there's a new face in the village.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A scare leaves Cleo and Sienna in turmoil. Tinhead resorts to drastic measures to hide his scheming. And Mercedes struggles to adjust to a change in her life.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Café Hon: The Café Hon restaurant in Baltimore is struggling because its owner has alienated the local community. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chiarella's: Gordon Ramsay visits South Philadelphia, where struggling family-run restaurant Chiarella's is pushing owners Tommy and Dina DeFino's marriage to the brink.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Have a Summer: Adam worries about being hazed by the older students when he goes to high school, but he soon earns their respect by body-slamming Barry.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Breakfast Club: Adam works on a new persona that he hopes will make him seem cool on his first day at high school, while Beverly gets her teaching certificate.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Heavy Is the Head: Will Phil have to rethink his property dream? And Cam has to go to hospital but refuses to have an MRI scan because of a traumatic childhood incident in a well.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Finding Fizbo: Cam is enraged when he sees a clip of someone desecrating his beloved Fizbo costume, so he sets out on a quest to restore Fizbo's good name.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants to find out if they've continued to follow his advice. How have Down City, Classic American and Davide fared in his absence?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he tried to help: the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, and Kingston Café, La Frite and Capri in California.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Road Trip: Jake tries to do something nice for Amy when he invites her boyfriend Teddy along on a work trip. It's a shame Amy's about to dump him...

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Pontiac Bandit Returns: Doug Judy is back in custody after scamming Peralta and Diaz when they last met, but Captain Holt offers him a plea deal.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season: After seeing A Christmas Carol on TV, Homer realises he's been too selfish and decides to make amends, culminating in a 'nice-off' with Ned Flanders.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays: When a baby riot breaks out at a children's concert, the town's childless community form an anti-youth lobby.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Han Ukkah Solo: When Beverly talks Erica into writing a Hanukkah song for the school holiday concert, she inspires Barry to prove his own musical prowess.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: O Captain! My Captain!: Beverly hopes to inspire the students when she takes over as substitute teacher in Barry's chemistry class. Adam embarrasses Emmy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Catch of the Day: Phil is convinced he's going to have a bad luck day after failing to complete his daily superstition. Mitch is certain that Cam is undermining him.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Sex, Lies, and Kickball: Jay's best friend, Shorty, returns from Costa Rica and stays at the house so that they can reconnect. And Alex is ready to shed her good-girl image.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Sabotage: Peralta thinks someone's trying to sabotage his professional life, but Santiago and Diaz aren't convinced. Boyle, Hitchcock and Scully work on a tricky case.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: AC/DC: Peralta injures himself chasing a suspect but won't take time off to recover. Holt and Diaz have an awkward dinner date with their significant others.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Big Fat Geek Wedding: On the eve of their nuptials, Edna calls it all off with Principal Skinner. As Marge consoles Edna, she realises her own relationship isn't so great.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Catch 'Em if You Can: Homer and Marge abscond for a romantic weekend in Miami, so Bart and Lisa chase them across the country to ruin their holiday.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Emotions flare as the McQueens gather for a family therapy session. Rex makes a gesture to repair the past, and one resident finds themselves in the wrong place at the wrong time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Squirt and the Whale: The Simpsons put up a wind turbine in their back garden. Lisa has an upsetting experience when she attempts to free a beached whale.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Barrister Sarah meets Dan, an ex-military man guilty of too many dad jokes. And besties Megan and Ellena are out on a double date hoping to have their trust in men restored.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's sharpest armchair critics think of Line of Duty, This Is My House, The Proof Is Out There, Formula 1: Drive to Survive, Countdown and This Morning?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of Line of Duty, Celebrity Bake Off, The Flight Attendant, Teen First Dates, The Circle, Remarkable Places to Eat, and Matt Hancock on This Morning?

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced to a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: (2016) Wild West horror starring Kurt Russell, Lili Simmons, Patrick Wilson, Richard Jenkins and Matthew Fox. Can a posse save townsfolk from their cannibalistic abductors?

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: (2015) Violent offbeat western starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Michael Fassbender. A 16-year-old Scottish lad travels to 1870s Colorado on the trail of his true love.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: Censor
programme.desc: (2021) Prano Bailey-Bond's subtle horror with Niamh Algar. Things get personal for a film censor who harbours unresolved family trauma, working during the video nasties panic of the 1980s.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Hail the Conquering Hero
programme.desc: (1944) Satirical wartime comedy starring Eddie Bracken as a man who becomes a celebrated war hero despite having been medically discharged from the marines after only a few weeks.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: (1963) Classic interpretation of the Greek myth of Jason's quest to find the Golden Fleece, boasting the enduring work of special effects maestro Ray Harryhausen. Directed by Don Chaffey.

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: (2003) Superhero fantasy. Ben Affleck is a blind lawyer who turns vigilante by night. Jennifer Garner plays his lover and Colin Farrell the villain who endangers them both. Strong violence.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: (2007) Nicolas Cage is Marvel's soul-hunting, hot-headed-biker antihero. When Mephistopheles's son starts causing trouble in hell, Ghost Rider is forced to sort it out. With Peter Fonda.

programme.title: Riders of Justice
programme.desc: (2020) Darkly comic thriller with Mads Mikkelsen. A soldier recruits three geeks to help him hunt down his wife's killer. In Danish/subs.

programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Street Kid: New Sun Hill team member Sgt Rachel Weston joins forces with Mickey and Mel to investigate links between a road traffic accident and a break-in at a jewellery shop.

programme.desc: Documentary series following life on a busy maternity ward. Hayley's baby is suffering from a diaphragmatic hernia, and will have to fight to survive outside the womb.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Bank Job: Classic war farce. Rene and Leclerc escape from the Resistance with the view to collect a ransom from General Von Klinkerhoffen. But they resort to robbing a bank.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Exploding Bedpan: Saucy French farce in David Croft and Jeremy Lloyd's wartime sitcom. Alfonse's dicky ticker plays up when he's being interrogated by the Gestapo.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Going Like a Bomb: Wartime romp. Captain Bertorelli, pockets crammed with loot, is snitched on. Michelle and Crabtree hatch another bonkers plot to ship the airmen to Blighty.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: LeClerc Against the Wall: LeClerc is arrested on suspicion of stealing the Gestapo's money and faces execution unless it's returned, but Edith's mother has cooked it in the oven.
